bibl.title: Demotic Graffiti in Oxyrhynchus.
Acts of the Tenth International Congress of Demotic Studies. Leuven, 26-30 August 2008.

bibl.note: Tomb N. 1 (in all nine sarcophagi) in the necropolis discovered by Mahmoud Hamza, now excavated by the SCA in collaboration with the University of Barcelona. - Hieroglyphic text [Saite period]. - Demotic text [early Ptolemaic period]. - Text of the West wall [14th of January 114 BC]. - Text of the East wall. - General commentary. The complex belonged to a family of priests probably serving in the temple of the goddess Thoeris.
bibl.seg: Ola El-Aguizy, Demotic Graffiti in Oxyrhynchus.

Mark Depauw & Yanne Broux (edd.), Acts of the Tenth International Congress of Demotic Studies. Leuven, 26-30 August 2008 = Orientalia Lovaniensia Analecta. 231 (Leuven - Paris - Walpole, MA, 2014) pp. 61-71, 4 pll.

Tomb N. 1 (in all nine sarcophagi) in the necropolis discovered by Mahmoud Hamza, now excavated by the SCA in collaboration with the University of Barcelona. - Hieroglyphic text [Saite period]. - Demotic text [early Ptolemaic period]. - Text of the West wall [14th of January 114 BC]. - Text of the East wall. - General commentary. The complex belonged to a family of priests probably serving in the temple of the goddess Thoeris.
